confirmed_facts: Fire broke out at approximately 2:50â€¯pm local time on 26â€¯Novemberâ€¯2025 in a highâ€‘rise apartment complex in Tai Po, Hongâ€¯Kong.
The building had 2,000 units and housed about 4,800 residents; 7 of 8 blocks were engulfed.
A bamboo scaffolding used for maintenance work was present and contributed to the fireâ€™s spread.
At least 13 people died, including one firefighter, and about 10 people were injured.
The Hongâ€¯Kong Fire Services raised the fireâ€™s severity rating to the highest level (5â€‘stage).
No Korean nationals were reported among the casualties.
